properties.name: Aberporth / West Wales
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeVery warm welcome from the tower. Must go back now the weather\'s warmer and amble to the beach.Coffee and Cake at Aberporth - Blog entry.

properties.name: Badminton
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeFlew up for the horse trials with my sister. Definately the way to arrive! Great welcome, marshalled to parking and met at the aeroplane to sort out landing and tickets. Great day out. Blog Entry: Off to the Horses (Again)

properties.name: Bembridge
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeWent here for what was intended as a day trip but we ended up getting stranded for two nights by the weather. Looked after wonderfully by the staff and a lovely B&B though. Blog Entry - "Well That Was An Adventure!"

properties.name: Bolt Head
properties.description: Posted by Leiafee Lovely little strip in a gorgeous spot. We took a tent and camped by the wings.

properties.name: Bourn
properties.description: Posted by Leiafee Flew in for the Burned Children\'sCclub flying day. Fabulous friendly place.

properties.name: Dunkeswell
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeExcellent food. Nice friendly field. Stopped over here for a few nights taking my sister and her little boy on holiday. Also visited for a ride-along while training. Backseat to Dunkeswell Visited more recently with a pal close beside me in formation! Am coming to the conclusion that the aircraft knows her way here without me by now. Also visited on the Devon & Cornwall Strip Flying weekend -- last stop on the way back to civilisation.

properties.name: Eaglescott
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeBit basic, but friendly.Eaglescott in the Haze - blog entry Also visited on the Devon & Cornwall Strip Flying weekend for coffee and the cheapest fuel of the trip.

properties.name: Galway
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeWent here on a fly-in with the Cambrian Flying Club. Very GA friendly, nice little regional airport.

properties.name: Gloucester
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeNice one if you feel a bit uneasy about dealing with full ATC, very friendly and helpful. Went here on my QXC.All my trips here so far have been training trips, but I keep meaning to go back. Landing fee a little on the steep side is the main deterrent!Flying Over the FoldFirst long trip with instructorRainbows at GloucesterSame again soloQXCVia Shobdon and Gloucester

properties.name: Haverfordwest
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeGreat brekkies. One of my favourite places to fly. My first solo landaway was to Haverfordwest and I did my skills test from there too. Trips While TrainingA Visit to MaintenanceFirst Solo LandawaySkills TestPost PPL TripsFirst PassengerTrips To Thwart The Weather- Delivering Red Noses

properties.name: Inishmore
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeDrop dead gorgeous spot to land an aeroplane! Little runwy by the beach. Visited as a detour on the way home from Galway during a flyout. Definately one to go back to.

properties.name: Kemble
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeLovely example of GA at its best. Loads of types and lots of visitors sitting in the sun watching them and enjoying the atmosphere.This was the first \'new\' airfield I went to after getting my PPL and I\'ve been back several times since. Blog EntriesStretching My Wings A Very Aeronautical Weekend

properties.name: Land's End / St Just
properties.description: Posted by Leiafee One of the stops on our flying/camping trip. Seemed a bit of a fomal airport for it, but they were quite happy for us to sling up a tent next to the aeroplane!

properties.name: Old Sarum
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeGorgeous setting and another lovely example of GA the way it should be. Pretty airfields and nice people.Flying to Old Sarum

properties.name: Old Warden (Shuttleworth)
properties.description: Posted by Leiafee Flew in for Project Propeller. Fantastic site, wonderful museum, friendly FISOs. Can\'t go wrong! Detail of the day on the blog.

properties.name: Pembrey
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeWonderfully friendly flying club. Beautiful spot. I learned to fly here.My Learning to Fly Diary Balloon Popping Competition 2006Two Trips to Thwart the Weather - Flying Blog entryCambrian Flying Club

properties.name: Perranporth
properties.description: Posted by Leiafee Stopped in for fuel on way back from camping.flying trip. Hugely friendly and helpful. BIt of a wobble on the approach over the cliffs though!

properties.name: Plymouth
properties.description: Posted by Leiafee Dropped in for fuel on way to camping/flying trip round Devon and Cornwall. Very accomdating even when I struggled to find the place!

properties.name: Rosemarket Golf Course + Airstrip
properties.description: Posted by Leiafee  Lovely, unusual little landing place! My first taste of anywhere qualifying as "strip" rather than "airfield". Landing on the Fairway is the blog post of that trip and The Definition of "Bimble" a more recent visit. Very welcoming owners. See the website at: Dawn Till Dusk

properties.name: Shobdon
properties.description: Posted by Leiafee Went here on my QXC. Lovely friendly field, and nice cafe. My QXC Writeup I also have been back lots of times with friends often for: Breakfast Flying - Blog Entry Or just because the route is pretty (blog entry)... The UKGA crowd had our Summer Bash here in 2007. The gliding was lots of fun!

properties.name: Sleap
properties.description: Posted by Leiafee Our current maintenance base for the tommyhawk

properties.name: St. Mary's (Isles of Scilly)
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeVisited with the flying club on bank hliday Monday. Blog entry Weird humpbacked runway -- quite a challenge -- I made an awful landing but the place itself is gorgeous!

properties.name: Swansea
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeGood cake in the cafe. I\'m based here these days, with a share in a lovely PA38 aptly registered G-TOMS.TrainingFor a while during my training we were based at Swansea instead of Pembrey.All ChangeFirst training flight from Swansea instead of Pembrey. - Bit of a culture shock!Up and DownOngoingScribblings of a novice PPL

properties.name: Waterford
properties.description: Posted by LeiafeeFlew in with a friend. Pretty spot but miles to go to civilisation! Don\'t make our mistake and try to walk!

properties.name: Wellesbourne Mountford
properties.description: Posted by Leiafee Flew in for a Flyer forum visit and look round the Vulcan. Fab!
